awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Workshop Set Theoretic Methods in    Algebra; May 28-31, 1990, Waco, Texas
awd_abstract_narration: This award will support a workshop on the applications of                  set-theoretic methods to algebra.  The workshop will be held from               May 28 to June 1, 1990 at Baylor University in Waco, TX.  This                  workshop has two main purposes: (1) to provide the audience with                a working knowledge of set-theoretic axioms and a working                       knowledge of infinite combinatorics used in the construction of                 algebraic structures, and (2) to help the audience to become                    aware of recent progress in this area and to learn to recognize                 situations where these methods are applicable.                                       This workshop is on the applications of axiomatic set                      theory, a branch of formal logic, to algebraic structures such as               groups, rings, and modules.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
